io.libraft.agent.persistence
Class JDBCLog

java.lang.Object
  io.libraft.agent.persistence.JDBCLog
All Implemented Interfaces:
Log
public final class JDBCLog
extends Object
implements Log

Implementation of Log that uses a JDBC backend.

This implementation creates and uses a single table called log_index with the following structure: 

 +-----------+-----------+----------+----------+
 | log_index |   term    |   type   |   data   |
 +-----------+-----------+----------+----------+
 |           |           |          |          |
 +-----------+-----------+----------+----------+
This table contains all the LogEntry instances communicated to the local Raft server. It uses the supplied CommandSerializer to serialize a Command for safe storage in the database. It uses a supplied, matching CommandDeserializer to deserialize a previously-serialized Command into its corresponding Java representation.

See Also:
Command

LOGGER

Constructor Detail

JDBCLog

public JDBCLog(String url,
               String username,
               @Nullable
               String password,
               CommandSerializer commandSerializer,
               CommandDeserializer commandDeserializer)
Constructor.

The account used to connect to the database must have permission to:

  • Create and/or delete tables.
  • Create and/or delete rows within these tables.
  • Query these tables.
  • Create and/or delete indexes.

Parameters:
url - JDBC connection string used to connect to the database
username - user id of the account used to connect to the database
password - password of the account used to connect to the database or null if no password is required
commandSerializer - instance of CommandSerializer that will serialize Command instances to the database
commandDeserializer - instance of CommandDeserializer that will deserialize database rows that contain Command instances into their corresponding Java representation
See Also:
Command
Method Detail

setupCustomCommandSerializerAndDeserializer

public void setupCustomCommandSerializerAndDeserializer(CommandSerializer commandSerializer,
                                                        CommandDeserializer commandDeserializer)
Set the CommandSerializer and CommandDeserializer used by this JDBCLog instance. This overrides the serializer/deserializer pair specified in the instance constructor.

Parameters:
commandSerializer - instance of CommandSerializer that will will serialize Command instances to the database
commandDeserializer - instance of CommandDeserializer that will deserialize database rows that contain Command instances into their corresponding Java representation
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called after a successful call to JDBCBase.initialize()

initialize

public final void initialize()
                      throws StorageException
Initialize the database backend.

This method creates any tables and/or indexes needed to persist data to the database. Table and index-creation happen only once. Subsequent calls to this method do not modify or delete existing data. An instance of Connection is also created.

This method does not validate any data already stored in database tables.

Throws:
StorageException - if the database backend cannot be accessed or initialized. The component is in an inconsistent state and should not be used if this exception is thrown
IllegalStateException - if this method is called multiple times

teardown

public final void teardown()
Clean up and release the resources used by the database backend.

This method closes the internally-cached connection. Following a successful call to cleanup() subsequent calls are noops.

execute

protected final void execute(io.libraft.agent.persistence.JDBCBase.ConnectionBlock connectionBlock)
                      throws Exception
Executes the nested SQL statements in a single transaction. If any exception is thrown, the commit is rolled back. Otherwise, when connectionBlock completes successfully the entire transaction is committed.

Parameters:
connectionBlock - block containing sql statements to be executed in this transaction
Throws:
Exception - on any error (from either connectionBlock, or while executing a SQL statement
